boardgame.name: Minimalist Descriptive Cave
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The adventurers traveling over the hilly terrain approach a mining-scarred, erosional cave filled with cave nettles.

This is a minimalist descriptive cave generator to help randomly roll a brief cave description for a setting description for gaming or writing. It helps generate cave types (sea, erosional, solutional, lavatube, glacier, ...), terrain, features, life: stalactite/stalagmites, cave plants, cave animals (troglobites, troglophiles, & trogloxene: cave spider, cave salamander, rat, bear, etc... .

One-page, easy, standard d6 dice system that may be used with any core system.

Although written as a stand alone tool, this product is solo rpg compatible ready—though not written for solo gaming, it takes zero conversion to use as a solo gaming description generating tool to help generate cave description that a GM might otherwise provide. It is part of the Clawed SRC Compatible ™ brand.

It is small and compact. It's just this black cover page and one written page.

boardgame.name: New Horizon Player's Manual
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Different role-playing rule systems can be applied and/or used with the New Horizon world and its different games.

Volt is a role-playing system developed to be used for different genres and worlds, with only a few adjustments for the setting. Volt has been adapted for New Horizon and is the official rule system for this book. This book is using version 3.0 of the Volt rule system.

Volt is a set of rules and practices designed to quickly and accurately determine the realistic outcome of a character's action, taking both skill and circumstance into account. The abilities of a character are summed up on the character sheet, and chance is represented by two twenty-sided dice (d20). No other dice or tables are used in-game.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Cities of Sigmar
boardgame.description:
The Cities of Sigmar are blazing strongholds of light and hope amidst the deadly wilds of the Mortal Realms.

Battletome: Cities of Sigmar is your guide to the mightiest bastions of Order in the mortal realms – and the grand armies of humans, aelves and duardins that bravely fight to defend them. Inside, you'll discover just what life is like for the Mortal Realms’ “ordinary” inhabitants – the countless sub-cultures, guilds and tribal groups that band together to fight for Sigmar and the pantheon of Order. Rich art, lore and seven short stories penned by renowned Black Library author Josh Reynolds bring the world of the Cities of Sigmar to life.

Meanwhile, a vast set of allegiance abilities and faction rules allow you to field powerful combined forces of Order units themed around the seven most famous Cities of Sigmar. Perhaps you’ll harness the myriad war machines of the Greywater Fastness, or field a rapid-strike force from Tempest’s Eye – the choice is yours, and with warscroll battalions, artefacts and dozens of warscrolls to choose from, the possibilities are endless. What’s more, you'll find loads of top painting tips, colour schemes, bespoke missions, Path to Glory rules and more – this is the ultimate resource for any Cities of Sigmar collector!

This 128-page hardback book contains:

A history of how the Cities of Sigmar were founded, including guides to the seven greatest metropolises in the realms
Seven thrilling stories penned by renowned Black Library author Josh Reynolds
Tips for collecting Cities of Sigmar Citadel miniatures and rules that allow you to fight battles with them on the tabletop
54 warscrolls representing the citizenry of the Cities of Sigmar * humans, aelves and duardin alike
Allegiance abilities that bestow a wide selection of battle traits, command traits, artefacts of power and unique spell lores upon your Cities of Sigmar collection
A battleplan representing the heroic efforts of a Cities of Sigmar army to relieve an ally besieged by the forces of darkness
Rules themed around the seven most famous Cities of Sigmar, as well as a powerful warscroll battalion for each city


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Z Day Survivor: Per Ullus Opes
boardgame.description:
Z Day Survivor: Per Ullus Opes ("By any means") is a turn based game of strategy and luck that features 8 unique characters for varying styles of play. Using a one-of-a-kind Zombie Survival Kit, track the spread of the virus, bonuses to movement, and organize items collected during your journey to become...the Z Day Survivor.

—description from the publisher

The city is cut off. No help is coming. Will you be bitten or will you fight, cheat, and steal your way to victory to become... the Z Day Survivor? Eight survivors trapped in a hospital receive an emergency broadcast, warning that no help is coming. The only chance for survival is to escape anyway you can to an extraction point near the far edge of town. There's just one catch --- salvation is on a first come, first serve basis and seats are in short supply.

The strategy is simple: MOVE, SCAVENGE, FIGHT. Each player enacts his turn in three phases.

Move -- Traverse the terrain as quickly as you can. It's a race to be the first to escape.

Scavenge -- Gather items and search for vehicles necessary to help you get ahead of the crowd.

Fight -- Behind each corner waits looters ready to strip you of your supplies, displaced civilians that may need your help, and zombies ready to tear at your flesh. Along the way, help or hinder your opponents, but take great care not to be bitter, the zombie virus spreads quickly and there are only a limited number of antidotes in play.

—description from the box

boardgame.name: Project Universe
Purojekuto Yuniba-su
プロジェクトユニバース
boardgame.description:
In the game Project Universe, a.k.a. プロジェクトユニバース, you represent an interplanetary carrier that transports freight to space stations. You procure resources for the freight, prepare to launch a rocket, and head for your destination.

Once your rocket lifts off, you cannot make any on-Earth actions for the rest of this round, so you have to make elaborate preparations on the ground. Your time is spent whenever you take an action, and you suffer a severe penalty if you overwork beyond your time limit.

To win the game, you have to calculate total time spent for on-Earth and in-space actions in order to deliver your freight efficiently, while mitigating penalties.

•••

boardgame.name: Rugby Champion
boardgame.description:
Rugby Champion is a Fast-paced tactical card game based on the Rugby theme. This game was designed to be enjoyed with the whole family. It is a simple, tactical and very dynamic game. It will immerse you in a rugby match as if you were there. An essential card game, designed for those oval ball passionate fans as well as for beginners that you should own by the end of the year.
The game offers 3 different play modes for 1 to 4 players, with short rounds.

The game is divided by rounds called "challenges ". These challenges represent the phases of a classic rugby match. Each player therefore tries to win these challenges to be able to score tries, by playing the action cards based either on the power (Physical game), on the dexterity (Hand game), or on the technicality (foot game). But beware, the strongest cards are also the most risky and in case of a risky play the referee can intervene at any time and whistle to mark penalties! And that way, we chain actions and challenges. The player with the most points after 2 halves is declared the winner!

The game takes the form of a series of challenges:

Physical and powerful challenge: simulates actions like rucks, scrums, etc.
Hand Challenge: simulates skilful actions such as passes, interceptions, etc.
Foot challenge: simulates tactical actions such as kicks, penalties, etc.


Despite the small size of our game, the dozens of card and tactical game combinations in 3 game modes (Solo, Duel or Conquest for 4 players) offer very good replay ability. In addition, because the game is played very fast, it is particularly suitable to play small tournaments or championships in less than one hour.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Space Buccaneers
boardgame.description:
In Space Buccaneers, you start out as a lowly vagabond looking to make a living by running jobs out of Buccaneer’s Den and appealing to The Man… the head behind all illicit business that happens in this corner of the galaxy. Successfully deliver on your contracts to gain credit and renown; fail, and you’ll find The Man’s confidence in your capabilities will dip. Work to upgrade your menial starting ship and crew to better push your luck within the Galactic Underground Trading Route (GUTR) and become the richest, most famous freebooter of all!

Space Buccaneers is game about taking on jobs and attempting to deliver their cargo to the furthest location possible along the GUTR. The trading route is comprised of a series of planetary systems willing to do business with the Den. The further along the route that you deliver, the more credit and renown you will gain. Along the course, you’ll be attempting to resolve events by rolling dice provided by your ship and crew. These are resolved by matching the symbols on the event cards with the symbols on the dice. As you roll misses and are forced to set dice aside, you’ll have to decide if you risk pushing on to profit from greater gains or not. If you roll too many misses, your delivery attempt will be cut short and your reputation will suffer. Events get harder as you press along the GUTR; the better your ship and crew the better your odds. The game ends when one of the players reaches the renown threshold. After which, players will have a chance to complete their turns, and the player with the highest amount of renown will be declared the victor.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The after story of Shibihama
Korogaru Shibahama
転がる芝浜 (The after story of "Shibahama")
boardgame.description:
転がる芝浜 (The after story of "Shibahama") is based on a human-interest rakugo vignette named "Shibahama". The title "転がる芝浜" (pronounced "Korogaru Shibahama") means "Rolling Shibahama", and the game has area control and resource management mechanisms and uses action dice.

You are an industrious fish merchant in Edo (ancient Tokyo). You used to be a lazy drunkard, but with a support of your wife, you have changed your mind and successfully abstained — but you cannot force your employees to abstain, and sometimes booze is required to keep business relationships. Are you able to manage your business while staying away from temptation?

You roll and place novice-worker dice and senior-worker dice on the game board to obtain fish, but you have to use these fish early because they gradually decay.

•••

boardgame.name: Targi: GeekUp Bit Set
boardgame.description:
Travel the desert in this classic two-player game with this truly amazing GeekUp set for Targi! Featuring our first mixed-medium set, the Targi set combines plastic tiles for the goods with METAL pieces for the gold coins, VP tokens, and the start player marker.

The metal pieces are 3D replicas of the original art from the game, crafted to be the same physical size and design as their cardboard counterparts.

The goods tokens are made of a hard plastic, similar to Bakelite, and the graphics are applied via a 4 color heat transfer process, which fuses the images to the plastic in a way that makes them very scratch resistant, meaning they should last a lifetime.

One set of GeekUp tokens for Targi includes the following 54 pieces:

10 date tiles (25mm squares, 4mm deep)
10 salt tiles (25mm squares, 4mm deep)
10 pepper tiles (25mm squares, 4mm deep)
1 metal start player marker (43mm tall)
6, 1-point metal VP markers (34mm tall)
5, 3-point metal VP markers (34mm tall)
4, 5-point metal VP markers (34mm tall)
8 metal gold coins (30mm diameter)

boardgame.name: Majolica Painting
boardgame.description:
Majolica Painting is a "flip & draw" game in which players will use crayons of four different colors to fill in blank tiles to create their own Majolica masterpiece!

Each player takes one game sheet for their own creation of a Majolica painting. Each round, one card is revealed from the deck, and each player may choose to draw the indicated colors on their sheet or pass. After all players have finished the drawing, another card is revealed for a new round.

If the player's pattern matches the goal shown on the revealed card, they can immediately gain the bonus and mark them on their sheet. Try your best to connect the same colors together. The more tiles of the same color you can connect, the more points you receive!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Trump Roast
boardgame.description:
Trump Roast is a meat-themed party game designed to help America solve the most ridiculous global policies. Trump Roast game is played with a minimum of 3 players and can be played with 12 or more. This game uses real Trump quotes, combined with Fake News, Veto, Collusion cards and complete with Trump cards for extra entertainment.

Use many of Donald's "best words" to choose his Position to the most ridiculous Policy questions that our celebrity president will be pre-occupied with while he's supposed to be leading our nation and making it great again. Packed with all the classic quotes and many nearly forgotten gems, Trump Roast game tackles many important policy questions including:


What does Donald have tattooed on his lower back?
What is the chorus to Ted Nugent's next single?
What does Donald yell when he shanks a drive at Mar-a-Lago?
How will Donald greet the world champion Green Bay Football Packers?
When Mike Pence's gay conversion therapy stops working, what is the backup line?

boardgame.name: Arschlochkind
boardgame.description:
Arschlochkind ("Asshole Kid") is a casual card game for 3-6 players. Your goal is to nurture and (mis-)educate your own child as badly as possible, while helping other players children to become good kids.

The Game is played in 3 phases with 4 rounds in every phase. Every phase represents a development stage of your kid (toddler, school kid, teenager).

Every player gets one illustrated kid card in the beginning. There are 4 values printed on the kid (they stand for health, freedom, love and success).
Every player tries to bring his kid up as badly as possible by laying transparent upbringing cards with negative values on his kid. Only the visible numbers count in the end. Other players can interfere with defense cards or by laying positive upbringing cards on your kid.

There are 3 different types of cards: Upbringing cards to lay on your or other kids, defense cards and action cards.

boardgame.description:
The year is unknown. The place is somewhere on Earth. In Secret Cthulhu players are attempting to stop Cthulhu devouring the planet by enacting enough Rites of Salvation to protect the planet and all that currently live on it. Watch out though, there are secret Cultists among you, and one player is possessed by Cthulhu himself. These Cultists will be doing everything in their power to pave the way for Cthulhu, and the destruction and chaos he brings with him.

At the beginning of the game each player is assigned one of three roles: Cultist, Investigator, or Cthulhu. The Investigators have a majority, but they don’t know for sure who anyone is; Cultists must resort to what they know best to accomplish their goals: secrecy and sabotage. Cthulhu plays for the Cultists, and the Cultists know Cthulhu’s identity, but Cthulhu isn’t always aware of who his fellow Cultists are and must work to figure them out.

If that's not enough, you need to be ready for whatever the Chaos Deck throws your way.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tori-Tenki
トリ天気 (Trick-Take BIRD & WEATHER)
boardgame.description:
Stable weather attracts various birds. And the birds call their friends. Everyone is trying to dominate in a corner of a small neighborhood.

"Trick-Take BIRD & WEATHER" is a trick-taking game where the tens digit represents the weather, and the ones digit represents different birds. However, functionally, the cards do not have suits. Players must follow the lead card with a card that shares either the same tens digit or ones digit as the card that was led, if they can. The highest card which followed will win the trick, and the player earns a number of points equal to the lowest ones digit of all cards played.

However, there are certain exceptions when the tens digit is a 1 where the low card may win the trick, and the highest ones digit may be the points awarded. There are additional exceptions when the tens digit of all cards played match, or when the card that would be scored has a 0 in the ones digit.

The game plays over one round (nine tricks), and the player with the highest score wins.

Enjoy a new & strange type trick-taking game.

boardgame.name: Fast Food Battle Royale
boardgame.description:
It didn't happen in 1993. It also didn't happen in 2007. But, as the saying goes, the third time's the charm. In the fall of 2019, a marketing ploy gone awry awoke something within the people of Earth. People began displaying powers related to the food that they've consumed. It was quickly discovered that neither nourishing, home-cooked meals nor meals from traditional \sit-down" restaurants granted this power. It had to be the cheapest of the cheap, the lowest common denominator. Perhaps this was all a big joke played on us by those who control our simulation. Or perhaps the sheer quantity of food and brand recognition that those locations associate themselves with tapped into some form of power heretofore undiscovered. Whichever the case may be, the power is here now and we have to deal with it.

The restaurants quickly tried to take advantage of the situation. After several bloody and saucy skirmishes, they collectively decided that working together was the way forward.

The year is 20XX. A small group of Mascots has been chosen to participate in the quadrennial Fast Food Battle Royale to determine which of your owning corporations gets to assume command.

Occupy Mars is a highly technical, open world, sandbox game about Mars colonisation. Build and upgrade your base, discover new amazing regions, conduct mining operations, retrieve water and generate oxygen, grow crops, fix broken parts, learn how to survive on Mars!Have you ever dreamt about visiting Mars? We always did! There are so many things to see and discover on the Red Planet, so many exciting technologies to be created, so many challenges to overcome! Humanity can do this and become a multi-planetary civilisation!

Build your base

Build and upgrade your base, make sure that there is enough water, oxygen, power and food to survive. Build greenhouses, oxygen tanks, fuel generators, connect all the pipes and cables, remember about proper cable management.

Fix broken parts

Fix broken parts using realistic electronic components and tools. Learn basics of smd, soldering, using hotair, electronic measurement tools and all the details necessary to fix your equipment.

Discover new regions

Explore different regions of Mars in search for valuable resources, discover mining sites and find the best place to build a city. Remember that you need to find a relatively levelled area with good access to underground water in place where temperatures don’t drop too much during the night.

Day / Night cycle

Experience open world, sandbox game with realistic day / night cycle and overcome real challenges that colonists have to face. Build solar arrays and batteries for energy storage, upgrade them and find the optimal way to power your colony.

Survive

Occupying Mars is not always fun and games. Sometimes things will explode, break or go not exactly as planned. Learn to cope with “Rapid Unscheduled Disassembly”. Sometimes you have to really act quickly before you run out of air, food or energy.

Upgrade your vehicles

Upgrade your vehicles and equipment in your garage. Organise your workshop and modify your rover. Change crane hydraulics, operate the robotic arm, dig for valuable resources, build mining rigs and more…

…but most importantly HAVE FUN on Mars!

Rover Mechanic Simulator is a game in which you are a mechanic working on one of the first Martian colonies. Your main tasks include the repair and maintenance of Mars rovers, so that the remaining crew can collect detailed information about the structure of the planet by using them.

Use tools

There are many devices at your disposal that will allow you to dismantle and maintain even the smallest parts of the rover. Use different tools such as a screwdriver, compressor, soldering iron, 3D printer and many more. In the later stages of the game, you’ll be able to upgrade them, making your work even more enjoyable and effective.

Fix integrated circuits

Not all parts need to be replaced in its entirety. You can use special workbenches that can be used to restore damaged IC’s and clean and maintain parts that have worn out during rover’s work. Thanks to this you can save resources for much more difficult tasks.

Be careful!

Use various devices which will help you prepare the rovers for the repair process. But be careful, their design is very delicate and hasty decisions can increase damage to fragile scientific instruments, which will require more time and resources to complete the job.

Restore the legendary rovers!

There are many devices on Mars which served people in the past but broke down at some point. You can fix and restore them to service. Thanks to you they can continue to perform their tasks by sending specialized information about the composition of the planet. “Spirit”, “Opportunity” and others have served people for years and they can still do it!

Gain experience, earn higher and higher ranks and undertake more and more difficult tasks. The future of humanity on Mars rests on your shoulders!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Tegal Manor - The Judges Guild Classic Reborn
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

First published by The Judges Guild in 1977, Tegel Manor is the oldest of the "Haunted House" adventures in fantasy roleplaying, and probably the very first megadungeon ever published. The Manor is a sprawling edifice of 250+ rooms filled with tricks, traps, puzzles, monsters, and situations both humorous and horrific. The huge manor house has been the curse of its owners, the Rump family, for generations - no matter how many times they have tried to get rid of it, the ownership manages to come back to them.

This intertwined and sinister relationship between the house and its chosen family is a history of horror, evil, and greed. There is a lot for the characters to learn about the curse, and their knowledge might just keep them alive long enough to tell the tale. If you've already seen the 1977 version of the Manor, there's a lot more for you to experience in this updated and expanded 5E version of the classic. This printing contains more detailed descriptions of the rooms, new areas, new monsters, new magic items, and much more, all with spectacular illustrations.

boardgame.name: Criminal City
boardgame.description:
Criminal City, 2019.

Here, every day, the eternal struggle between the Law and the "Interstellar Mob" is rekindled without respite and shows no signs of dying out, also due to the scarce resources available to the police.

The 3 powerful interstellar criminal factions are fighting to command the entire city, fueling the black market, the corruption and the sense of insecurity of citizens, while few but brave space policemen face them every day to try to stop them.

And which side are you on?

Criminal City is a partially asymmetrical and semi-collaborative game for 3-6 players divided into a number of rounds depending on the number of players participating.

In each game a single player chose to be the head of a criminal faction(in this case he is playing as a "Interstellar Mob" Player) or, alternatively, can control policemen (1 or more, depending on the number of players).

The players who lead the criminal factions win individually by accumulating more Dominion Points (DP) than their rivals and trying not to be arrested by the space police.
The policemen win if they manage to capture all the factions fighting for the city's control within two consecutive turns or if, at the end of the game, they managed to limit the Criminals by accumulating at least 5 DP more than the most powerful faction.

—description from the designer

The Story

Dreams, nightmares, stories from parents, books, the world infiltrating our deep minds. The happy dreams get us through the day, our lives, and brighten our futures. The dark dreams, nightmares, feed upon our fears, they grow into monstrous proportions

The Nightmare is here, it has managed to manifest itself in our world, and it has whisked your parents away deep into the heart of Darkness, a place of horror and terror. Now the children must enter the Dreamlands together and rescue them, and in the process, confront their worst fears.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rendering Ranger: R2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Rendering Ranger: R2 is a 1995 side scrolling action video game developed by Rainbow Arts and published by Virgin Interactive for the Super Famicom. It was released only in Japan, and has gone on to be one of the rarest Super Famicom titles in existence.

Players control the titular Rendering Ranger, a special forces soldier tasked with defending the Earth and its remaining inhabitants from a devastating alien invasion. A high score screen is present and there are many different types of laser guns to acquire throughout the post-apocalyptic adventure. The player can choose from three to seven lives. However, there are no continues so practice is essential to winning the game. The player can take five hits before losing a life but pits automatically make him lose a life. Weapons are found in floating orbs, and each color holds a different kind of gun.

boardgame.name: Imminent Collapse
boardgame.description:
Imminent Collapse is a cooperative strategy game where players work together as the special operations team, Black Falcon. The team must gather Intel, secure designated Target Sites, and clear Rebel strongholds while managing their collective resources as well as mission time.

Game Play Overview

Arrange the 9 Sector tiles in any configuration.
Draw cards from the game deck to establish the sites of the Rebels, Intel, and Targets and place the colored cubes on those sites. Return those cards to the deck and shuffle it.
Each player will draw a certain number of cards to start the game.
Based on the locations of the Rebels, Intel, and Targets, players will place the Insertion and Extraction tiles adjacent to any of the Sector Tiles. All players start the game at the Insertion Point.
The game is divided into three 10 day Phases. Players try to acquire Intel cubes in Phase 1 and Rebel/Target cubes in Phase 1 and 2. The cubes can be used in Phase 3 to acquire various special abilities.
Each player can take three actions per turn. These actions include opening a Portal, acquiring Intel, capturing a Rebel, neutralizing a Target, trading cards with other players, or moving from one site to another. All actions can be repeated during a turn.
At the end of a turn, players can discard any number of cards and draw additional cards to meet the hand limit.
When all players have completed their turns, the Mission Tracker is advanced one day. By the end of Day 30, players must capture all Rebels, neutralized all targets, opened Portals at the Insertion and Extraction Points, and returned to the Extraction Point in order to win the game.




—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Megaera
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet the Avenging Angel...

Shireel’s friends could do little but stand by and comfort her as she sobbed watching Herman Wasserberg smilingly receive a crowd of well-wishers. The holofilm executive had just won the court case she had brought against him; two agonizing years of pre-trial motions, testimonies, shifting alliances, cross-examinations, repeated journeys into her own personal hell, and public scorn had finally come down to a “not guilty” verdict for him, and unending mental torment for her.

Wasserberg reached the door of a grav limo that had glided silently up for him. He turned momentarily to wave one last time at the crowd just as his head exploded in a cloud of reddish mist. Chaos quickly ensued. Shireel’s friends hustled her back inside the courthouse and relative safety as police streamed to the scene.

Later, when Shireel arrived at her apartment, she found a small folded piece of paper tucked into the door jamb with only three words in neat handwriting: “You’re welcome. Megaera.”

Lucene Kaz was a talented rising star in the Naval Intelligence office, respected for her intel analysis and profiling skills. Until a lustful commanding officer took the ultimate liberty…and with it, Lucene’s self-esteem, her reputation, and ultimately her career. After watching the perpetrator get away with what he had done, she took matters — and justice — into her own hands. And ever since she’s been willing to do the same for other women who suffered similar wrongs under the codename Megaera, an ancient spirit of vengeance.

Dossier: Megaera is an offering in the Dossier series for 2D6 games such as Cepheus Engine or the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.) The file offers a brief character sketch, a personality sketch, character motivation, character stats usable for CE and the OSFRPG, and suggestions for using this avenging angel in the Referee’s own universe.

boardgame.name: Super Computer
boardgame.description: A card-drafting and tableau-building game. Players receive a hand of cards, each turn they select one, play it face up in front of themselves, and pass the remaining ones to the player on their left. Cards must be connected in a grid to build a super computer. Black connections are wild, all other connections on the cards must match an identical connection. Cards that cannot be connected are placed in a personal discard pile, and generate negative point. Each player's computer is scored at the end of each round. The game lasts 3 rounds.

boardgame.name: Fire in the Goblin Forge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to One Page Dungeon. A simple and easy role-playing-game for one player. As the title suggests, you can play with a single sheet of paper. This game is perfect for a plane ride, hotel room, or anywhere else. You can even compete with your friends to see who can get the most gold.

The game works simply. You move along a grid, creating new random rooms and corridors with random monsters and treasure until you encounter the boss. It is great for fans of rouge-lite games.

Create a character from 3 different classes. Choose weapons, armor, and spells to suit your play style.

This first volume sees your character diving into a Goblin Forge to kill as many of the little green guys as possible while racking up the treasure. Pick up your bow, take up the ax, and jump into One Page Dungeon.

All you need are these rules, a single sheet of paper, a pencil/eraser, and a handful of six-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Tanto Monta: The Rise of Ferdinand and Isabella
boardgame.description:
Prequel to "Here I Stand", the famed Ed Beach game published by GMT GAMES. It is a game for 4 players (Muslim, French, Portuguese and Spanish) covering the period of the Reign of the Catholic Kings and the era of voyages of discovery.

This is a CDG where each player has to reach 45VP to win in the course of 7 maximum turns. Players play cards for their event or to perform actions from a list of available actions for each power and at a specific cost for each action. VPs are earned either by military objectives, discoveries of new zones, trade, real weddings or certain events. In each turn the 4 players alternate playing cards and so on until the end of the turn. The combats is by means of dice rolls with possible support of combat cards and taking into account the type of participating unit.

—description from the designer

Precuela de "Here I Stand", el afamado juego de Ed Beach publicado por GMT GAMES. Es un juego para 4 jugadores (musulmán, francés, portugués y español) que abarca el periodo del reinado de los Reyes Católicos y la era de los viajes de descubrimientos.

Se trata de un CDG en el que cada jugador tiene que conseguir 45 PV para ganar en un máximo de siete turnos. Los jugadores juegan cartas como evento o como puntos para realizar acciones del listado de las disponibles para cada potencia, con un coste específico para cada acción. Los PV se obtienen mediante objetivos militares, descubrimientos de nuevas zonas, comercio, bodas reales o determinados eventos. En cada turno los cuatro jugadores se van alternando jugando cartas hasta terminar el mismo. Los combates se resuelven mediante tiradas de dados, con posibles apoyos de cartas de combate, y según el tipo de unidad participante.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

boardgame.name: La course des loutres
boardgame.description:
Embody a family of three otters that must be protected by crossing the river as quickly as possible to reach their lair.

At his turn, each player rolls both dice at the same time.
Of these 2 dice, the player chooses one, and only one, and moves one of his otter pawns to the next identical available animal
to the one inscribed on the die. The second die will not be played.
The player has the choice to advance any of his 3 otters, following the one that suits him the most according to the dice.
During his journey, he moves his otter towards the next animal available, ignoring the boxes of the same animal already
occupied by its otters or those of the opponents.

Once the move is made, it is the next player's turn.

In case of double, namely 2 identical animals, the player advance one of his otters to the animal in question and play again immediately (this effect is cumulative).
To get his 3 otters into the lair, the player can use the animal of his choice when the tile is on the face with 6 circles animals.


The game ends as soon as one of the players has his 3 otters in the lair.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Amulet
boardgame.description:
Presentation on Essen Spiel 2021

Amulet is an exciting adventure where each player takes on a mantle of a monster hunter with five unique characters to choose from.

Players are tasked with stopping the forces of evil pouring out from the ruins of the dark castle. Every day players will have to visit various locations, obtaining skills and useful items, repairing their equipment, carrying out tasks and, of course, battling various monsters.

The ultimate goal is to rid the neighborhood of evil. The player who performs best at this task wins the game.

The game's events take place over several 'days' (rounds). Each day players move their characters' figures to various locations to perform available actions. Characters have their own unique sets of equipment:amulet, weapon and item tokens to be used against monsters in combat. The combat resembles a dynamic puzzle: players select weapons and items based on the monster's type, and this choice affects the chances of victory in the fight as well as potential spoils of war. Players gain Victory Points for defeating monsters and successfully carrying out tasks. Whoever obtains more VP by the end of the game becomes the winner.

boardgame.name: Disney Rocket Game
boardgame.description:
Disney Rocket game is a 1960's Japanese variation of Pachisi. The game board features 4 Walt Disney characters which players start by placing their tokens on. Players then move around the board by the roll of a dice in a clockwise direction and up a straight to reach their goal line.

Variations to the traditional Parchisi are an added shortcut using a colored rocket and advantages of landing on a particular colored square.

The game box shows Disney characters on a TWA rocket. Erik Voskull, in his book 'Before Mario',(2014) explains that Nintendo obtained a licence in 1959 to produce games featuring Walt Disney characters and themes.

Also in the first half of the 1960s Nintendo introduced a cursive style logo as seen on the back of the playing board. This logo was used on Nintendo's earliest boardgames.

—user summary

Our world needs heroes, and only a small band of adventurers stands between us and the darkness that threatens everything.

Play Manga d20 is an anime roleplaying game option for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game® that brings the fun of owning pet monsters, flying in giant mecha, and being a magical hero of ancient legend to the table. Don’t just play your favorite tabletop game, Play Manga!

Contents Include
Races: Variant races for androids, catfolk, dhampir, rabbitfolk, ratfolk, and turtlefolk, as well as a new race for slimes.

Anime Classes: Introduces 15 new classes, centered on anime characters. They are adventurers, dynamic sorcerers, giant robots, gun bunnies, hot rods, magical heroes, martial artists, mech pilots, ninjas, samurai, sentai members, shapechangers, students, and techn geniuses.

Fantasy Classes: Using the 300 point system, the fantasy classes are broken down into their features, then presented with new archetypes to choose from that give them a more anime-based flare.

Character Options and Attributes: Learn how to build a point-based character, or pick up a race and class using the point-based system as a guideline for how to hand out experience and when to level up. Includes over 100 attributes, defects, and restrictions. Also includes feats, modern weapons and vehicles.

boardgame.name: The Undead Leviathan (OSRIC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is an aggressive ecology? It’s a new type of challenge for your players, a monster with many faces, a web of interrelated challenges that can together form a complex encounter-in-depth. It is a world-building device based upon a magical interrelationship between disparate, yet connected creatures. It is, in short, something not seen before and something not quickly forgotten.

There are few aggressive ecologies found in the deep oceans, and only one centered upon the rotting carcass of a fallen whale. A whale fall is an unusual event in and of itself, but occasionally these massive bounties of detrital material land in places that simply cannot sustain natural life of any sort: a negative energy sink. These strange negative energies infuse a whale carcass with unholy power giving unlife, mobility, and malevolence—creating an undead leviathan. But worse, after enough time, the undead leviathan rises to torment the land!

This aggressive ecology presents a terrible challenge to all 1e/OSRIC Player Characters and is easily adaptable to any OSR system. Present your players a new type of challenge, the Aggressive Ecology!

boardgame.name: The Slaver Fungus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is an aggressive ecology? It’s a new type of challenge for your players, a monster with many faces, a web of interrelated challenges that can together form a complex encounter-in-depth. It is a world-building device based upon a magical interrelationship between disparate, yet connected creatures. It is, in short, something not seen before and something not quickly forgotten.

Most aggressive ecologies are of a terrestrial nature, indigenous to a single planet, and found only in a particular location. But some few travel between the planets, hitchhiking on space-faring matter that eventually lands upon a new and unwitting location. The slaver fungus one such aggressive ecology that arrives on a new world via a meteoroid strike, and if conditions are favorable it expands outward from that location, feeding upon the local organic material until it grows large enough to reproduce, sending its exploding spores to the very limits of the atmosphere. In that instant, it becomes a new threat throughout the entire world.

This aggressive ecology presents a terrible challenge to all 1e/OSRIC Player Characters and is easily adaptable to any OSR system. Present your players a new type of challenge, the Aggressive Ecology!

boardgame.name: This IS Rocket Science
boardgame.description:
In This IS Rocket Science, players look to become the most prolific space explorer by landing on or orbiting planets. All game cards serve a dual purpose, acting as both the planets for scoring and the rocket fuel used to reach the planets.

On a turn players will draft cards from a central tableau or combine cards from their hands to reach exact target rocket fuel numbers to either land on or orbit a planet in the tableau. To score a planet, a player will discard cards from their hand and multiple the rocket fuel values together to hit the aforementioned target number. Some cards can also be discarded in order to add or subtract from the fuel value.

boardgame.name: Strategist Strategy
軍師軍略
boardgame.description:
"Who would have thought that we would have to face each other in battle like this..."

Two strategists, who had once been fellow disciples and studied under the same master, find themselves devoted to carry out the most refined battle of wits, bearing the burden of protecting their home country.

A strategist, however, will never enter the battlefield themselves.
They send out instructions to the Shogun in action based on the information provided by the messengers rushing back and forth from the battlefield.
Figure out the other player’s intention with the help of the time lag in-between to aim for victory.

The game begins with 3 kinds of game pieces, Infantry, Archer and Cavalry taking position.
How do you establish an advantageous battle formation as you go into battle?

The key to victory is to understand how to properly utilize the special command, the Chain Message, which allows game pieces of the same kind, positioned next to each other in a vertical or horizontal direction, to advance in the same way and in the same turn.
Be conscious of coordinating your military forces and never dividing your formation.

WHAT KIND OF GAME IS IT?

Strategist Strategy is a strategy game for 2 players. The goal is to take down the Shogun of the other player by moving your own pieces, similar to Chess or Shogi.
However, it has the following distinctive features.


You are free to place the soldier pieces anywhere you want at the beginning of the game. The players take turns, placing 1 piece per turn. The placement of the pieces shall be determined with ever-evolving strategies while watching the moves and battle formation of the other player.
There are only 3 different kinds of soldier pieces.
You are not able to move the pieces immediately during your turn. You may only move them according to the commands issued by “cards” in the previous turn. It is not guaranteed that the game pieces will move as expected.
When pieces of the same kind are aligned next to each other, either in a vertical and horizontal direction, you may move them together in the same turn, up to more than 2 pieces at once.


For example, 3 Infantry pieces in a row may move forward at the same time or multiple Archer pieces may shoot arrows at the same time. In order to win, it is key to establish a good set-up/formation for yourself and break up the set-up/formation of the other player.

After the initial placement, the players decide in secret which game piece will become the Shogun piece, which is the defining piece for winning or losing the game.


It is crucial to predict the Shogun of your opponent during the game play.
In order to get a taste of being a real military strategist, we created this game for 2 players and added game elements that will hopefully remove unrealistic game elements that we had experienced in other strategy simulation games.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ambitions of Space
Амбиции Космоса
boardgame.description:
Ambitions of Space is a space 4X strategy about military, economic, technical and political confrontation in the vastness of an unknown galaxy.

On the way to the victory of their power, players establish colonies on distant planets, develop infrastructure and science, form battle fleets and, at their own peril and risk, explore the anomalies of outer space.

The goal of the game is to bring the player-controlled nation to prosperity and global superiority over its competitors. There will be one winner, but you can win one of four ways:

Military victory: capturing the capital of one of the rivals, you will win, since few can resist its military power.
Political victory: Having received the most Senate seat, the player wins, as he now decides which laws apply in the galaxy.
Economic victory: by increasing the capital turnover to 30 units per move, the player wins, since there is no longer in the galaxy what he could not buy.
Scientific victory: legally gaining fifth-level technology, the player wins, as he is now the engine of progress.

boardgame.name: Mythology Manual: Fairies, Deities & Shamans for 5th Edition Games
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book will use actual mythology and folklore to help you understand the world of deities, fairies, and magic from a time when people gossiped about encountering the magical world the way we might discuss encountering a celebrity. With this book the GM will be able to create new rich adventures, and NPC’s for the characters to overcome, meet, and befriend. PC's will also be given more ways to interact with the world in which they play, through new options, and ways of thinking of their surroundings. In addition to helping you expand the worlds in which you already play, this book can help you to develop your own world. Either way, this book will be different from most Manuals and Guides, because it will use quotes from actual myths and tales to explain the different creatures within. Ancient peoples believed that nearly everything had a cause that the fortunes and misfortunes, and even the strange behaviors of humanity occurred because of magical creatures that inhabited everything. Known by many names these faeries, fey, good folk, spirits, etc would help inspire artists, cause cows to grow ill, or make winter come early.
